intro: Puelia ciliata, commonly known as the silky pellitory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive silvery-blue appearance, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Puelia ciliata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
